intro: Oreogrammitis pseudospiralis, commonly known as the spiral moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green to blackish-green foliage. The leaves are typically elongated and have a distinctive spiral arrangement, contributing to its common name. It thrives in dry, shaded environments, often found on rocky substrates or in crevices. This moss is known for its resilience to desiccation and is commonly found in temperate and arctic regions.
